ratings.comment: Prof Van Lehn was an informative and funny professor. His lectures were straightforward, although they tended to be derivation heavy with few practical examples. He provided practice problems for exams that made midterms easy to prepare for. Grading was very fair. Cons: Discussion was unhelpful and HW problems required lots of Excel/Matlab use.

Prof. Van Lehn is definitely the BEST professor I've ever had, super smart and also fun. Incredibly clear lectures and explanations, inspirational homework, and fair exams with similar practice problems provided. Taking thermo with Van Lehn = success + actually learning. I really enjoyed his class and hope he can be my professor for all classes!

He is one of the best professors I've had at UW-Madison and tied with Murphy for best in CBE.
Modern class with tricky HW problems that allow derivation thermodynamic figures and datasets.
Exams are extremely fair. Class is tough. I didn't know thermodynamics could be taught in such a definitive way.

Easily one of the best professors in the engineering department. He is extremely well liked by the students despite teaching notoriously difficult subjects. His class is challenging but the work load manageable.

Van Lehn is a great professor. The course is very difficult, but he does his best to actually "teach" the material. He makes his lectures very easy to participate in by having group discussion times to help with understanding. He seems like he cares about his students' learning very much.

Extraordinary professor and person, try to learn as much as possible from him! always oriented when teaching. He's got your back. It is not an easy course at all! at times you may wanna cry, but Van Lehn is your guy.

Incredibly clear and well-planned lectures with supplemental typeset lecture notes. Exams were fair with plenty of practice problems provided for preparation. Always available for office hours and is happy to answer questions. Overall a very knowledgeable and friendly professor, easily one of the best in the College of Engineering.

Prof van Lehn is one of the better CBE professors. He has a nice sense of humor and does a very good job with lectures. He is clearly very interested in what he does and happy to discuss concepts outside class, as well as answer questions in class. Problem sets and exams could be difficult, but support was provided if you asked.

Professor Van Lehn is the single greatest professor I have ever had in my life. I have never seen a professor that cares as much as he does for their students to learn the material. The class is extremely challenging, but you will have all the resources to be prepared for exams and do the homework. Please enjoy your time with Prof. Van Lehn.

Professor Van Lehn is my favorite CBE Professor so far. He is so knowledgeable and very approachable if you have any questions about the concepts. He loves what he does and that makes his lecturers very interesting!

This was his first time teaching an undergraduate course, and he was great. Knew the content very well, relayed it clearly and descriptively to students, was very helpful and good at answering student questions. Also, wasn't a dull professor, he tried to make lectures interesting and not so monotone. Probably my favorite CBE prof so far.

Professor Van Lehn is definitely the best chemical engineering professor I have had thus far. His lectures are very clear and he is extremely knowledgeable about the topic. The work load is reasonable and he makes the important topics very clear.

This is his first class he is teaching, and honestly, he has been my favorite lecturer I have had. The content is challenging, but as long as you take advantage of his amazing lecture notes and informative office hours, you will do well. Also, a definite chili pepper.
